title: About
text:
I’m Justin and I am currently in my fourth year at UCLA as a statistics and data science major. I thoroughly enjoy all things that come with statistics and the skills I’ve gained over the years have allowed me to analyze various kinds of situations for patterns and trends that can lead to actionable insights.
What I’m most passionate about is combining the intricacies of statistics and the biological world to gain a further understanding of the living world around us.

title: Justin Tong
text: Hi! My name is Justin and I am a fourth year undergraduate student pursuing a statistics and data science major at UCLA.

title: Justin Tong
text:
Personal Projects

NBA Game Outcome Prediction

Developed a predictive model to classify game outcomes using methods such as logistic regression and k-fold cross-validation techniques.
Performed data cleaning and preprocessing, ensuring the accuracy and quality of historical game data for analysis.
Evaluated model performance through metrics such as accuracy, precision, and recall to optimize predictions.



Bike Rental Data Analysis

Conducted exploratory data analysis to identify key factors (e.g., weather, humidity, time of year) influencing bike rental trends.
Utilized statistical and data visualization tools such as Tableau to uncover correlations between environmental variables and rental demand.
